description: Before the shepherds take their flocks of sheep to the pasture, there are 100 hectares of grass available.
Given the current situation, 10 flocks of sheep are brought to the pasture by each shepherd, consuming 10 hectares of grass.
Emma took 13 flocks of sheep to the pasture, thus consuming 13 hectares of grass.

The group of shepherds, John, Kate, Emma, and Luke, discuss their monthly pasture consumption and agree to coordinate their efforts to ensure a sustainable balance between earning income and preserving grass for the future, setting a target of 20-22 flocks of sheep per shepherd for the next month and proposing a system for sharing consumption data and reviewing it regularly.
conversation: Mayor

Ladies and gentlemen, let me give you the monthly pasture report. John consumed 17 hectares of grass. Kate consumed 28 hectares of grass. Jack consumed 28 hectares of grass. Emma consumed 13 hectares of grass. Luke consumed 14 hectares of grass.
John

Hey everyone, I'm a bit surprised to see Kate and Jack both taking 28 hectares of grass. I thought we could have coordinated better to leave more for the next month. I'm planning to take around 20-22 flocks of sheep to the pasture next month. Anyone else have any thoughts on their strategy?
Kate

Hey John, I understand your concern, but I was thinking that since the grass doubles at the end of the month, we can still have a good amount left over. I'm planning to take around 25-27 flocks of sheep to the pasture next month. I think it's a good balance between earning income and leaving some grass for the next month. What do you think, Emma and Luke?
Emma

I understand your points, Kate. I was thinking of taking around 18-20 flocks of sheep to the pasture next month. I'm a bit concerned that if we all take a large number of flocks, we might not leave enough grass for the next month. Maybe we could discuss a more coordinated approach to ensure we're all earning a good income while also leaving some grass for the future. What do you think, John and Luke?
Luke

I think Emma's suggestion of a coordinated approach is a great idea. I was thinking of taking around 16-18 flocks of sheep to the pasture next month. If we can agree on a rough estimate of how many flocks each of us will take, we can ensure that we're not over-consuming the grass and leaving enough for the next month. What do you think, John and Kate? Maybe we can even consider setting a target number of flocks to aim for as a group?
Kate

I like the idea of a coordinated approach, Emma. I think it's a good way to ensure we're all earning a good income while also being mindful of the grass's growth. I'm willing to compromise and adjust my target to 23-25 flocks of sheep next month. What do you think, John and Luke? Can we agree on a rough estimate of 20-22 flocks per shepherd?
Luke

I think a target of 20-22 flocks per shepherd is a good compromise. I'm willing to commit to that range for next month. I also think it would be helpful to review our past consumption patterns and the resulting grass levels to get a better sense of how our decisions impact the pasture's growth. Maybe we can share our past consumption data and discuss any trends or insights we can glean from it.
Emma

I think that's a great idea, Luke! Reviewing our past consumption patterns and sharing our data can definitely help us make more informed decisions. I've been keeping track of my own consumption, and I noticed that when we all take around 15-17 flocks of sheep to the pasture, we tend to leave around 60-70 hectares of grass at the end of the month. If we stick to the 20-22 flocks per shepherd target, I think we can aim for a similar range. What do you think, John? Can you share your thoughts on our past consumption patterns?
John

I think reviewing our past consumption patterns is a great idea, Luke. I've also been keeping track of my own consumption, and I noticed that when we all take around 15-17 flocks of sheep to the pasture, we tend to leave around 60-70 hectares of grass at the end of the month. I agree with Emma that aiming for a similar range with the 20-22 flocks per shepherd target is a good goal. I'm willing to commit to that range for next month. I also think it would be helpful to establish a system for sharing our consumption data and reviewing it regularly to ensure we're making informed decisions.
Emma

I think we're making great progress in coordinating our efforts and considering the long-term impact on the pasture's growth. I'd like to suggest that we establish a system for sharing our consumption data and reviewing it regularly, as John mentioned. Perhaps we can create a shared document or spreadsheet where we can track our consumption and share it with each other. This way, we can easily review our past consumption patterns and make adjustments as needed. Additionally, I think it would be helpful to set a specific date and time to review our consumption data and discuss any changes we'd like to make. What do you all think?
